prop.head.headtext: Thorburn, Law of Confidential Business Information

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Practical Advice for Protecting Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: The nature of the business and the practice of the trade will influence the courts in their determination of whether information is confidential.[1] Accordingly, any industry standards or practices, including those of a moral or ethical nature, that relate to the use of information must be referenced and should form part of any employment discussions, agreements and policies.

Drake International Ltd. v. Miller (1975), 61 D.L.R. (3d) 420, 9 O.R. (2d) 652 (H.C.J.); Thomas Marshall (Exporters) Ltd. v. Guinle, [1978] 3 W.L.R. 116 (Ch.); Fraser v. Thames Television Ltd., [1983] 2 All E.R. 101 (Q.B.); Ken Graham Consumer Products Ltd. v. Sunbeam Corp. (Canada) Ltd. (1989), 25 C.P.R. (3d) 52 (Ont. H.C.J.).
